properties.displayName: Kubernetes cluster should not use naked pods
properties.description: Block usage of naked Pods. Naked Pods will not be rescheduled in the event of a node failure. Pods should be managed by Deployment, Replicset, Daemonset or Jobs

metadata.description: DEPRECATED parameter: This policy by definition should only evaluate original pods, rather than pods created by workloads. As such, source is hard-coded to Original. The source k8s object for constraint evaluation. 'Original' means only evaluate against the specific GroupVersionKind specified in the policy definition. 'Generated' means only evaluate against k8s objects generated by Gatekeeper ExpansionTemplates. 'All' means evaluate against both the original object and any generated ones.
Whether or not to return warnings back to the user in the kubectl cli
'Audit' allows a non-compliant resource to be created or updated, but flags it as non-compliant. 'Deny' blocks the non-compliant resource creation or update. 'Disabled' turns off the policy.

List of Kubernetes namespaces to exclude from policy evaluation. System namespaces "kube-system", "gatekeeper-system" and "azure-arc" are always excluded by design. "azure-extensions-usage-system" is optional to remove.
List of Kubernetes namespaces to only include in policy evaluation. An empty list means the policy is applied to all resources in all namespaces.
Label query to select Kubernetes resources for policy evaluation. An empty label selector matches all Kubernetes resources.

schema.description: A label selector is a label query over a set of resources. The result of matchLabels and matchExpressions are ANDed. An empty label selector matches all resources.

matchLabels.description: matchLabels is a map of {key,value} pairs.

matchExpressions.description: matchExpressions is a list of values, a key, and an operator.

key.description: key is the label key that the selector applies to.

operator.description: operator represents a key's relationship to a set of values.

values.description: values is an array of string values. If the operator is In or NotIn, the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is Exists or DoesNotExist, the values array must be empty.
